text: [Music]
my sister was having another baby I had
sent him some clothes and he didn't fit
into them because they were so quickly I
thought that their clothes should adapt
to that growth
[Music]
the clothes look quite unusual how are
you going to make sure people want to
wear clothes that look so different
yeah I believe these clothes look so
futuristic and obviously some of the
market might not be ready for it these
are the final stage prototypes and now
I'm forming my core team of a passion
designer a textile designer to start
going into those aspects we're gonna
focus on very gender-neutral styles
particularly so that you can pass these
clothes on between siblings who are of
different genders so that's like another
interesting sustainable aspect of this
there's obviously profit to be made for
retailers in having parents buy new
clothes all the time do you think you'll
face resistance from the industry for
this idea yeah I do think that I'll find
some resistance but there are benefits
for retailers such as inventory cost
savings because these clothes grow seven
sizes it makes it a lot easier for
especially smaller retailers to manage
have you got any plans to make clothes
like this for adults I'm considering
that because we've had so many requests
from adults and that's something we're
looking into particularly maternity wear
because pregnant women obviously changed
the size very quickly and yeah it's
something we'll be looking at into the
future
